ARABIC: قَالَ لَا تُؤَاخِذْنِى بِمَا نَسِيتُ وَلَا تُرْهِقْنِى مِنْ أَمْرِى عُسْرًا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Musa said, 'Do not take me to task because I forgot. Do not demand of me something which is too difficult.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: (Moses) said: "Do not hold me for having forgotten, and do not reprove me and make my task difficult."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Moses said: "Do not take me to task at my forgetfulness, and do not be hard on me."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Moses said, "Please, forgive my forgetfulness. Do not oblige me with what is difficult for me to endure."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Said Moosa, “Do not apprehend me upon my forgetting, and do not impose difficulty on me in my task.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: He said: "Call me not to account for what I forgot, and be not hard upon me for my affair (with you)."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: He said: Blame me not for what I forgot, and do not constrain me to a difficult thing in my affair.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: He said, 'Do not take me to task that I forgot, neither constrain me to do a thing too difficult.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: (Moses) said: Be not wroth with me that I forgot, and be not hard upon me for my fault.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: He said, "Do not take me to task for what I have forgotten, and do not be hard on me on account of what I have done!"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Musa said: take me not to task for that forget, and impose not in my affair hardship.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: He said, ‘Do not take me to task for my forgetting, and do not be hard upon me.’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Moses said: "Rebuke me not for forgetting, nor grieve me by raising difficulties in my case."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: [Musa (Moses)] said: "Call me not to account for what I forgot, and be not hard upon me for my affair (with you)."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Moses said: 'Do not blame me for what I forgot, nor press me to do something which is too difficult'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: He said, “Do not rebuke me for forgetting, and do not make my course difficult for me.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: [Moses] said, "Do not blame me for what I forgot and do not cover me in my matter with difficulty."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [18:73] He said, ‘Do not take me to task on account of that which I forgot, that is, [on account of the fact that] I was not mindful of submitting to you [in the matter] and of refraining from showing disapproval of your actions, and do not exhaust me, [do not] charge me, in this affair of mine with difficulty’, [with] hardship   during my companionship of you, in other words, treat me throughout it with forgiveness and indulgence.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: ((Moses) said: Be not wroth with me that I forgot) your advice, (and be not hard upon me for my fault) do not tax me severely for my fault.
